description: From French salpe, from Ancient Greek σᾰ́λπη (sálpē, “porgy”).

entries.meaning: Any of the free-swimming tunicates of the order Salpida and its single family Salpidae.
examples: Salps are capable of self-propulsion, but for the most part, these translucent, gelatinous-looking animals float in mid-water going wherever the prevailing currents take them. […] At times a number of buds are attached to one another in linked chains commonly called salp chains.
